{{Other people}} {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Danny McBride | image = Danny McBride WonderCon 2013.jpg | caption = McBride speaking at the 2013 [[WonderCon]] at the [[Anaheim Convention Center]] in [[Anaheim, California]]. | birth_name = Daniel Richard McBride{{cite web|last=Byrne|first=Paul|title=Danny McBride talks Eastbound & Down & his upcoming Movies|publisher=Movies Ireland|date=2008-09-14|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xz6EDTadgt8|accessdate=2010-11-14}} | birth_date = {{nowrap|{{Birth date and age|1976|12|29}}}} | birth_place = [[Statesboro, Georgia]], U.S. | medium = Film, television | nationality = American | active = 2003–present | spouse = {{marriage|Gia Ruiz|2010}} | children = 2 | notable_work = }} '''Daniel Richard McBride''' (born December 29, 1976) is an American actor, comedian, and writer. He starred in the [[HBO]] television series ''[[Eastbound & Down]]'' and ''[[Vice Principals]]'', both of which he co-created with frequent collaborator [[Jody Hill]]. He has also starred in films, such as ''[[The Foot Fist Way]]'' (2006), ''[[Pineapple Express (film)|Pineapple Express]]'' (2008), ''[[Up in the Air (2009 film)|Up in the Air]]'' (2009), ''[[Your Highness]]'' (2011), ''[[This Is the End]]'' (2013), and ''[[Alien: Covenant]]'' (2017). ==Early life== McBride was born in [[Statesboro, Georgia]].{{cite news|last=Fine|first=Marshall|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/foot-door-cult-comedy-star-danny-mcbride-article-1.328410|title='Foot' in the door for cult comedy star Danny R. McBride|newspaper=[[New York Daily News]]|date=2008-05-23|accessdate=2013-09-08}} His mother, Kathy Rudy, and his stepfather both work at [[Marine Corps Base Quantico]] as civilian support.{{cite web|author=Gavin Edwards|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/news/kenny-powers-and-the-unlikely-rise-of-danny-mcbride-20120219|title=Kenny Powers and the Unlikely Rise of Danny McBride|publisher=''[[Rolling Stone]]''|date=2012-02-19|accessdate=2013-09-08}} McBride has English, [[Jewish]], Scottish and Irish heritage.{{cite news|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/theticket/2011/0415/1224294709616.html|work=The Irish Times|title=The prince McBride|date=April 15, 2011}}{{cite web|url=https://www.gq.com/story/funnyman-of-the-year-danny-mcbride|title=Funnyman of the Year: Danny McBride|first=Mickey|last=Rapkin|date=November 17, 2008|website=Gq.com}} He was raised [[Baptist]].{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cPFO7n8W9Eg|title=WTF Podcast - DANNY MCBRIDE|first=|last=WTF Podcast Marc Maron|date=July 4, 2016|accessdate=December 30, 2017|publisher=[[YouTube]]}} His mother performed sermons in church using puppets, and McBride stated that his "interest in telling stories comes from her". He was raised in [[Spotsylvania County, Virginia]], where he graduated from [[Courtland High School]] and attended [[North Carolina School of the Arts]] in [[Winston-Salem, North Carolina]], and became one of the "Three Flavas" along with well known director Jody Hill and Kris Baucom.[https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1298&dat=19950525&id=hP4yAAAAIBAJ&sjid=vwcGAAAAIBAJ&pg=5707,4877942 ''The Free Lance-Star'']; News.google.com, accessed August 18, 2014.[https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1298&dat=20060806&id=GC4zAAAAIBAJ&sjid=dAgGAAAAIBAJ&pg=3439,1534232 ''The Free Lance-Star'']; News.google.com, accessed August 18, 2014.{{cite web|url=http://fredericksburg.com/News/FLS/2008/012008/01242008/351013/index_html?page=1 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130124083300/http://fredericksburg.com/News/FLS/2008/012008/01242008/351013/index_html?page=1 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-01-24 |title=Movie, TV projects fall in line for local native |website=Fredericksburg.com |date=2008-01-24 |accessdate=2013-09-08 }}{{cite web|last=Rottenberg|first=Josh|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20217822,00.html|title=Breakout Actor: Danny McBride|website=Ew.com|date=2008-08-08|accessdate=2013-09-08}}{{cite news|last=Freydkin|first=Donna|title=Danny McBride is in the 'Express' lane to fame|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2008-08-14-danny-mcbride_N.htm|work=USA Today|date=August 14, 2008}} ==Career== In 2006, McBride played Fred Simmons in the low-budget comedy film ''[[The Foot Fist Way]]'', which he co-wrote with collaborators [[Jody Hill]] and [[Ben Best (actor)|Ben Best]]. He appeared in character as Simmons to promote the film on ''[[Late Night with Conan O'Brien]]'' on February 26, 2008. He wrote and starred in the [[HBO]] original comedy series ''[[Eastbound & Down]]'' (also a collaboration with Hill and Best), as Kenny Powers, a washed up former [[major league baseball]] pitcher with [[anger management]] issues. The series was produced by [[Gary Sanchez Productions]], and the pilot episode premiered on February 15, 2009, featuring [[Will Ferrell]] and [[Craig Robinson (actor)|Craig Robinson]]. On April 8, 2009, HBO announced it had renewed the series for a second season.{{cite web|url=http://www.thrfeed.com/2009/04/hbo-renews-eastbound-.html|title=TV Show News and Ratings - Live Feed|website=Thrfeed.com|accessdate=30 December 2017}} On July 2, 2012, HBO renewed the series for a fourth season.{{cite web|last=Levine|first=Stuart|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118056210|title=HBO asks for more ‘Eastbound & Down’|work=Variety|date=2012-07-02|accessdate=2013-02-06}}{{cite news|last=Levine|first=Stuart|url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118026471?refCatId=14|title=HBO re-ups two half-hour comedies|work=Variety|date=2010-10-27|accessdate=2011-03-23}} The series ended on November 17, 2013. In March 2009, because of his role as Powers, he received an offer to play professional baseball for the [[Pensacola Pelicans]], a minor league team in the [[American Association of Independent Professional Baseball]].{{cite web|title=Pensacola Pelicans kick off season May 14 with great talent|url=http://www.splashpensacolabeach.com/news/2009-05-01/Home/002.html|work=Splash! Northwest Florida's Entertainment Magazine|accessdate=September 26, 2013}}{{cite web|title=Professional Baseball Team Offers HBO's Kenny Power 2009 Contract|url=http://www.oursportscentral.com/services/releases/?id=3787537|work=OurSportsCentral|accessdate=September 26, 2013}} In 2010, he signed an endorsement deal with [[K-Swiss]] shoes and played the eponymous roadie in the [[Tenacious D]] music video for "Roadie" in 2012. McBride starred with [[Walton Goggins]] in the HBO comedy series ''[[Vice Principals]]'' from 2016 to 2017. McBride is currently{{when?|date=January 2018}} co-writing a script with [[David Gordon Green]] for [[Halloween (2018 film)|a sequel]] to ''[[Halloween (1978 film)|Halloween]]'', to be directed by Green and produced by series creator [[John Carpenter]] and [[Jason Blum]].{{cite web|url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/news/3424120/david-gordon-green-danny-mcbride-rebooting-halloween-october-2018/|title=David Gordon Green and Danny McBride Rebooting 'Halloween' for October 2018 - Bloody Disgusting!|website=bloody-disgusting.com}}{{cite web|last1=Galluzzo|first1=Rob|title=David Gordon Green, Danny McBride Will Direct/Write The New HALLOWEEN Movie For Blumhouse!|url=http://www.blumhouse.com/2017/02/09/david-gordon-green-danny-mcbride-will-directwrite-the-new-halloween-movie-for-blumhouse/|website=[[Blumhouse Productions|Blumhouse]]|accessdate=15 February 2017}}{{Cite web |url=https://www.stereogum.com/1966097/qa-john-carpenter-talks-new-album-anthology-the-upcoming-halloween-sequel/franchises/interview/ |title=Q&A: John Carpenter Talks New Album Anthology & The Upcoming Halloween Sequel |last=Daw |first=Robbie |date=2017-10-09 |website=[[Stereogum]] |access-date=2017-10-09}} In January 2018, two trailers were released online for what was supposedly a ''[[Crocodile Dundee]]'' sequel, titled ''Dundee: The Son of a Legend Returns Home''. The film was said to star McBride as Brian Dundee, the son of the original Crocodile Dundee. The trailers also feature cameo appearances by Australian actors [[Chris Hemsworth]], [[Hugh Jackman]], [[Russell Crowe]], [[Margot Robbie]], and [[Ruby Rose]].{{cite web|last1=Garcia|first1=Arturo|title=Is a 'Crocodile Dundee' Sequel Being Released in 2018?|url=https://www.snopes.com/fake-crocodile-dundee-trailer/|website=Snopes|accessdate=24 January 2018}} From the beginning, various aspects of the campaign made some publications believe that film was an elaborate hoax.{{cite web|last1=Moran|first1=Rob|title=Crocodile Dundee reboot outed as advertising campaign for Tourism Australia|url=https://www.brisbanetimes.com.au/sport/nfl/crocodile-dundee-reboot-outed-as-advertising-campaign-for-tourism-australia-20180124-h0nlmz.html|website=Brisbane Times|accessdate=24 January 2018}} It was later reported that these ads were actually part of a lead up to a [[Super Bowl commercial]] for [[Tourism Australia]]. ==Personal life== He has a sister Melissa McBride. McBride married Gia Ruiz in October 2010. They have a son and a daughter.{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-moms/news/danny-mcbride-wife-expecting-baby-boy-201174|title=Danny McBride, Wife Expecting Baby
